item.title: Report E-2025060445
item.description:
Report E-2025060445

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-12
  • City: CUMBERLAND
  • State: MD
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 2500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 6/12/2025 at 09:05 hours personnel in the CSXT Cumberland Yard discovered UTLX 679084, a Loaded tank car of Amines, Liquid, Corrosive, NOS, leaking from the top of the car. The car was isolated and the shipper, Taminco US (Eastman Chemical), was notified via CHEMTREC (Report 2025-06120-0090). SPSI, a CSXT emergency response contractor, was dispatched to the scene and found 6 of 8 manway cover bolts less than tool tight. Contractor personnel secured the manway cover and decontaminated the exterior of the tank car. The issue was identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shippers representative- Melissa McCaslin.

item.title: Report E-2025070209
item.description:
Report E-2025070209

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-10
  • City: JESSUP
  • State: MD
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO ENTERPRISE SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 7500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 1030 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal XJP. It was reported that an unknown amount of UN1266 released from tote due to improper loading. The release impacted trailer # 4354014. ERTS will proceed to dispatch a contractor to the site to complete cleanup activities. An ETA will be provided once it is known. Contractors responded and observed that a 20-gallons release of Roof Odor Solutions Additive was released due to forklift puncture. The Contractor inspected the Roof Odor Solutions Additive. The contractor advised (5) 55G DM of waste was generated. All waste was left on-site. The contractor left all waste onsite

item.title: Report E-2025060447
item.description:
Report E-2025060447

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-07
  • City: CUMBERLAND
  • State: MD
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 2500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 6/7/2025 at 20:43 hour, personnel in the CSXT Cumberland Yard reported PROX 44177, a residue tank car of Petroleum Distillates NOS, leaking from the top area of the car. The car was isolated and the shipper, Centennial Energy, was notified via CHEMTREC Report # 2025-0613-00. SPSI, a CSXT emergency response contractor, was dispatched to the scene and found the car to leaking vapors due to a faulty vacuum relief valve. Contractor personnel removed the faulty vacuum relief valve and installed a blind closure to stop the product release. The car was held pending further repair by a certified shop or OTMA. The issue identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shippers representative- Brian Newcome (303-597-5678).

item.title: Report E-2025060457
item.description:
Report E-2025060457

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-02
  • City: Baltimore
  • State: MD
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: AIRGAS USA LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 1440
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: Our tractor and bulk Liquid Carbon Dioxide trailer was traveling north on Interstate 95 when it struck debris in its path of travel. The debris punctured the driver side diesel fuel tank. Approximately 75 gals of diesel fuel was released through the puncture in the tank. This release occurred in less than 10 minutes. The Maryland Transportation Authority Police responded and MDE Emergency Response cleaned up the spill.
